body:
No offense, but this is some poorly written piece of code. Most notable errors to me:

* The use of `#inject` must have originated from a good intention, but if you have to `break` inside the block, it's making it more complicated than it should be. Using `#all?` would break as soon as the block would return false, in addition to resulting in a more concise code.
* A ternary operation to return either `true` or `false`!?
* If this method is added, it must be available for all numeric values, not just integers. Regardless of whether a numeric value is a `Float` or an `Integer`, one would expect it to respond to `#multiple_of?` with no prior cast to an `Integer`.

The whole method could be reduced to a single line:

```ruby
class Numeric
  def multiple_of?(*numbers)
    zero? || numbers.all? { |n| n.nonzero? && modulo(n).zero? }
  end
end
```
The gist with a small inline test: https://gist.github.com/984482
